recipe_name: Sesame-crusted salmon with orange and soy sauce
author: James Tanner
method: Coat the salmon slices in the sesame seeds.  Heat the oil in a frying pan over a medium heat. Add the salmon and fry for 3-4 minutes on each side, or until cooked through and golden-brown on both sides.  Add the coriander, dill, orange juice and soy sauce and continue to cook for 2-3 minutes, until the sauce is bubbling.  To serve, place the sesame-crusted salmon pieces onto a serving plate, spoon the orange and soy sauce over the fish, and garnish with the orange segments.
ingredients: 125g/4Â½oz salmon fillet, skin removed, sliced in half,  1 tbsp sesame seeds,  1 tbsp olive oil,  2 tbsp chopped fresh coriander, leaves only,  1 tbsp chopped fresh dill,  1 orange, juice only,  2 tbsp soy sauce,  1 orange, peeled and segmented, to serve
